rComments: she was a respectful and engaged professor. The class was intense (during the summer, 2 weeks!) so we spent many hours together in a very collaborative setting. I liked her course reader, and I appreciated how approachable she was.

Michah Perks often recounts how "she was once told that she knows how to write but not tell a story". She utilizes this same mindset to grade your work. It's not really about the content or your ideas, but if you write like she wants you to.

Micah is a really great professor. She is SO nice and was great at engaging the students. The only problem I had with her was at times it was really difficult to figure out what she wanted. I'd love to take a class with her again, though.

Really nice, very smart, very accepting, easy to approach.  Usually has a fun class, I actually looked forward to going to her class most of the time.  I am a complete **** and **** jerk but she was still sweet as pie to me and she never yelled at me for my idiotic beliefs or the stupid things I would say in class.  Great teacher all around.

Micah knows exactly what she is talking about, but sometimes doesn't know how to pass on the information.  That said, her 'intro to creative writing' course was helpful in that her assignments cover a wide range of genre's and she always brought in interesting and insightful (sometimes eyeopening) 'visiting authors.'
sweet, helpful, and inspiring. gives good feedback on work. very comfy office.
